headline: Did Exelon's (EXC) New Grid Plan and Tech Leadership Shift Its Regulated Growth Narrative?
summary: Exelon recently announced that Tim Peterson, currently chief information and technology officer at Xcel Energy, will join as executive vice president and chief customer and technology officer in February 2026, leading an integrated organization that aligns customer strategy with information technology across more than 10.7 million utility customers. At the same time, Exelon’s ComEd unit has introduced long-term Transmission Security Agreements and a new multi-year grid plan that aim to...

headline: Assessing Exelon (EXC) Valuation After New Grid Plan Customer Relief Fund And Transmission Agreements
summary: Exelon (EXC) is back on investor radar after a series of customer focused moves, including a new multi year grid plan in Illinois, fresh transmission security agreements, and an added US$10 million for energy bill relief. See our latest analysis for Exelon. Those customer focused moves and grid plans are landing at a time when Exelon’s 1 year total shareholder return of 17.6% contrasts with a softer 90 day share price return of a 7.28% decline. This hints that shorter term momentum has cooled...
